page.title: 11STORNOWAY S. LOCAL RADIO
page.content: Radio Nan Eilean was started by the BBC in October 1979 mainly because they thought that the area to be covered by Radio Nan Eilean (The Western Isles,Skye and the West coast mainland from Kinlochbervie in the north to Kyle of Lochalsh in the south) deserved more local programmes especially in Gaelic. A lot of people listen to the programmes. An audience survey done some time ago showed an audience figure of 86%, one of the highest figures of any radio station in the United Kingdom. People listen most during the winter when there is less work to do out of doors. The staff at Radio Nan Eilean is 1 senior producer, 1 General producer, 1 young peoples programme producer, 2 secretaries and 1 part time cleaner.{ {
